title: Autumn Nation Series: France defeats Australia in thriller at the Stade de France
description: A gutsy effort from Damian Penaud put France ahead in the final minutes to defeat Australia 30-29 in a nailbiter in Paris.

title: For the first time, Iran admits supplying drones to Russia before Moscow's invasion of Ukraine
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky on Saturday, November 5, accused Iran of lying about its drone deliveries to Moscow: 'We shoot down at least 10 Iranian drones every day, and the Iranian regime claims that it allegedly gave little and even before the start of a full-scale invasion.'

title: 'A shocking injustice:' Africa, the continent paying for the effects of a climate crisis it did not cause
description: The continent is already paying a heavy price for the effects of a climate crisis it did not cause. During COP27 in Egypt, from November 6 to 18, African countries are set to demand a fair energy transition, prioritizing access to electricity for 600 million people.

title: Tennis: World No.1 Alcaraz pulls out of Paris Masters and Davis Cup for medical reasons
description: Alcaraz tweeted on Saturday that his medical team had assessed his injury and it was 'an internal oblique muscle tear in the left abdominal wall with an estimated recovery time of six weeks.'

title: Two climate activists glue their hands to Goya painting frames at the Prado
description: In recent weeks, several groups of environmental activists have glued themselves to artistic masterpieces in an attempt to raise awareness of the climate crisis.

title: COP27 to open under the dark shadow of political prisoner Alaa Abd El-Fattah's hunger strike
description: The British-Egyptian activist became a symbol of repression of the youth who were involved in the revolution in Egypt in 2011.

title: In US midterms, secretaries of state are an administrative role with high political stakes
description: Republican candidates convinced of voter fraud in the 2020 presidential election could be elected as secretaries of state on Tuesday and be in charge for the 2024 presidential election.

title: Iranians stage new protests despite increasingly aggressive crackdown
description: Up to 10 people, including children, are feared to have been killed Friday in a crackdown on protests by Iranian security forces in the southeast of the country, human rights watchdog Amnesty International said.

title: France's far-right party picks Bardella to succeed Le Pen as leader
description: The ambitious 27 year old becomes the first person to lead the Rassemblement National who doesn't have the Le Pen name since the party's creation a half-century ago.

title: America's right-wing intellectuals undergo illiberal transformation
description: A nexus of American Catholic intellectuals are advocating a regime change to end abortion and fight the increased focus on identity issues, which they associate with liberal democracy.

title: US midterms: The new 'voting integrity' militias
description: 'The US midterm elections as seen from my French window': Armed militias 'defending' the vote are the unexpected new element in the 2022 midterm elections, writes former US correspondent Gilles Paris.

title: North Korea launches more missiles as US flies supersonic bombers in support of South
description: The launches came as the United States and South Korea conducted their largest-ever joint air force drills, which an infuriated North Korea described as a display of US 'military confrontation hysteria.'

title: Ugandan designer transforms second-hand clothes to sell them in the West
description: Bobby Kolade, the founder of Buzigahill, wants to revitalize the local textile industry, hampered by the continuous influx of clothes from Western countries.

title: Hunting in France: 'The more the practice of hunting diminishes, the less it is accepted and understood'
description: According to anthropologist Charles Stépanoff, opposition to hunting and its practices can be explained by the invisibilization of violence in modern societies. It also reflects a recent evolution in 'our relationship to nature and to living beings.'

title: Thomas Piketty: 'It is impossible to seriously fight climate change without a profound redistribution of wealth'
description: The only way out to limit the effects of global warming is to drastically reduce the wealth and income of the richest, argues economist Thomas Piketty in his column.

title: COP27: Egyptian conference criticized by human rights organizations
description: Egyptian activists fear a backlash after the climate conference running from November 6 to 18 in Sharm-El-Sheikh.

title: The healthy wine tradition of the Hospices de Strasbourg
description: The Hospices de Strasbourg's cellar has been producing wine since the end of the 14th century, originally as a remedy for its patients. On the brink of disappearing in the 1990s, this unique combination of health and alcohol has now become a wine tourism attraction.

title: US midterms: With a slew of races and referendums, voting in California is no easy task
description: The US midterm elections are about more than just federal or state-level offices. In San Francisco, voters will have 55 boxes to check!

title: In China, Olaf Scholz pleads for an economic rapprochement between Berlin and Beijing
description: The German chancellor was criticized by both his European partners and members of his own government for meeting President Xi on November 4. In doing so, Mr. Scholz made his divergent opinions crystal clear.

title: US speaker Pelosi makes first public appearance since husband's assault
description: Nancy Pelosi spoke publicly on-camera on Friday, November 4, for the first time since the attack on her husband, Paul.
